result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley Joshua Boness was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

02:54 PM DA calls cases 16CM52, 17CM35 and 17CM112 and states appearances. Defendant Bradley Joshua Boness in court with attorney Kristopher R Ellis.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties acknowledge receipt of revocation packet, and waive its reading. Court notes the name is referred to "Mr. Meyer" in section 9 in revocation packet and questions if this information is correct and the name is incorrect or the whole paragraph is incorrect? Atty Ellis states all employment information in revocation packet is incorrect and updates court on DEs employment history. Recommendations by DA. Comments by Atty Ellis and motions for jail sentence to be concurrent as recommended. Comments by DE. Summation by the court. 

Court imposes:

16CM52 
Ct. 1 -30 days jail with Huber, cs to any other sentence in being. 
Reimpose all prior monetary obligations with credit for payments made.

17CM35 
Ct. 2 - 15 days jail with Huber, cs to any other sentence in being.
Reimpose all prior monetary obligations with credit for payments made.

17CM112 
Ct. 2 - 60 days jail with Huber, cs to each any other sentence in being. 
Reimpose all prior monetary obligations with credit for payments made.

DE is given 71 days jail credit

11:15 am - DA calls cases 16CM52, 17CM35, 17CM109, 17CM112 and states appearances and agreement reached. Defendant Bradley Joshua Boness appeared with attorney Steven G Richards.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On motion of DA, Court dismisses Ct 1 in 17CM35, Cts 2-4 in 17CM109, and Cts 3-4 in 17CM112.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to Ct 2 on 17CM35, Ct 1 on 17CM109, Cts 1 & 2 on 17CM112. DA certifies Victim Rights Compliance. Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on the above Cts.  Court imposes:

10:48 am - Court calls cases 17CM112 and 16CM52 and DA states appearances.  Defendant Bradley Joshua Boness appeared in person with attorney Steven G. Richards appearing telephonically.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions DE regarding obtaining public defender on 16CM52.  In that case, a motion to enter JOC was filed on that case.  Court questions DE regarding mailing address.  Argument by DA. Court sets off the motion hearing on 16CM52.  Court advises DE to follow up with obtain an attorney on that case. On 17CM112,  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.

11:05 am - DA calls cases 16CM52 and 16CT34 and states appearances and agreement reached.  Defendant Bradley Joshua Boness appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to all counts.  Court questions DE regarding the pleas.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on 16CT34, and a deferred JOC on 16CM52.  DA certifies victims right compliance.  DE to submit DNA sample at PRSO.  Court imposes:

16CT34 - $831 fine which includes costs and DNAAS.  Pay plan of $100 per month beginning 12/31/16 and each month thereafter or CO.

16CM52 - Deferred judgment for 1 year - See written order
